title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 June 2009 - XWiki

KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 12:58): hi all  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 12:58): is there a simple way to disable the wysiwyg editor ?  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 12:58): a xwiki.cfg property perhaps ?  
trifon left at 12:59 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 12:59): otherwise i probably make that functionality, or create some mod\_rewrite voodoo to redirect to the normal editor  
tachirei joined #xwiki at 13:04  
guillaum1 joined #xwiki at 13:25  
asyd - (22/06/2009 13:27): sorry to ask that again, but I really need it. When is planned the next release of watch?  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:14): asyd: I don't know, I guess Anca is the only one who can answer  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:14): she's worked on it  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:14): the idea is to release it ASAP  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:14): but I don't know how close is ASAP  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:15): she's off right now  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:15): s/off/taken some days off/  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:16): note that the next release's goal is only to makte watch work with latest XE and not to add new features  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 14:22  
mflorea left at 14:22 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
asyd - (22/06/2009 14:24): vmassol: ok  
asyd - (22/06/2009 14:24): well, working with latest xe is ok :)  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 14:25): asyd: I know anca has done commits on it already so it may be it's already working with latest xe in svn trunk  
asyd - (22/06/2009 14:26): ok  
trifon joined #xwiki at 14:27  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 14:31): hi!  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 14:35  
arunreddy\_ left at 14:38 (Remote closed the connection)  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 14:49): cristinaS: hi  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 14:52): i have a problem .. I would like to use for the moment the rendering module .. and  my extension is not a component so I cannot use the component manager like in the documentation http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/RenderingModule  . I've noticed that for OpenOffice Importer are used annotation like @Requirement. Can I use these ones too? What should I include in order to  build  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 14:56  
Enygma` left at 14:57 (Remote closed the connection)  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 14:59  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:00): cristinaS: the main question is why is your code not in a component?  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:01): (I need to understand this before I can suggest ideas)  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:01): not really .. i am asking how can i use the rendering module without being a component ..   
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:02): or is it necessary to be a component?  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 15:07): hi all i've just installed 1.9 for testing and i noticed that editing a section causes all other sections to be removed from the document with XWiki syntax 1.0, can't find anything in Jira, is this known ?  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 15:12): cristinaS: I'm not sure that you need XOO to be a component in order to access other components. But obviously you'll need the component manager first.  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:13): yes ..  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 15:14): I'm no java expert, but i'm not sure how OSGi will work with UNO. I think some issues may occur since the class loader is not a common java class loader, right?  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 15:14): afik, many things are wrapped from a C++ runtime  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:15): it not a common java class loader .. i have to specify some registration issues  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:17): what do you suggest to do? ..if in a month I will have some rpc services that makes for me the parsing should I implement a whole converter now?  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 15:18): the best solution is to use components. but i'm afraid that you'll have problems adapting a component manager to open office.  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:19): KermitTheFragger: doesn't ring a bell, looks like a regression, can you file a jira?  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 15:19): vmassol: sure  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:19): what has more special a component?   
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:20): florinciu: what problem?  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 15:20): vmassol: i also noticed the section editing doesn't show up with xwiki syntax 2.0, is it a 1.0 thing ?  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:20): openoffice is ok if i use some external libraries and I put them in the extension archive  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:20): components in xwiki are java constructs so provided you run in a jvm it should work fine  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:20): KermitTheFragger: re section editing in 2.0 yes we haven't implemented it yet  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 15:21): cristinaS: Since you have a limited time and you're also lagging behind the initial plan, it's preferable not to spend to much time on this.  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:22): i don't want to spend time .. but I want to edit and publish a xwiki page  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:22): so i don;t think i have other alternativeas  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:22): do you have one in mind?  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:22): KermitTheFragger: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2881  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 15:23): vmassol: ok thanks, i was just wondering if it could somehow be related, but the section editing is intentional  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:25): florinciu.cristinaS: to use xwiki components in a JVM you just need to initialize the xwiki component manager. That's 3-5 lines of code.  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:26): oh .. nice  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:26): (if you want to know how to do it just check core/xwiki-servlet/.../\*ServletContextListener.java)  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:27): thank you  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 15:31): vmassol: i created http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4019  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:31): KermitTheFragger: thanks  
KermitTheFragger - (22/06/2009 15:31): vmassol: np  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 15:41): vmassol: do you have a more specific location for core/xwiki-servlet/.../\*ServletContextListener.java ? I can't seem to find it in the core https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/. I'd like to take a look at it too   
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:41): i'm still searching it too..  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:42): cristinaS: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-containers/xwiki-container-servlet/src/main/java/org/xwiki/container/servlet/XWikiServletContextListener.java  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:42): thanks  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 15:42): thnks  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:44): so .. this is that part , right? EmbeddableComponentManager ecm = new EmbeddableComponentManager();  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 15:45): i think so, it says :  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 15:45):         private ComponentManager componentManager; //  The component manager used to lookup for other components.  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:46): ecm.initialize(this.getClass().getClassLoader());  this.componentManager = ecm;  
Chathurag joined #xwiki at 15:47  
arunreddy joined #xwiki at 15:51  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 15:54): vmassol: couldn't the OOo custom class loader cause problems, since it's not the one in the jvm?  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 15:54): cristinaS:  anyway, give it a try  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:56): florinciu: since the Embeddable manager takes a CL you can pass it the OO one or any one you want  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:56): that's why it's embedabble btw :)  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:56): (meaning it can work in any environment)  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:56): so i will use EmbeddableComponentManager as component manager, right?  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:57): cristinaS: one thing is that if you're using exisitng components hiwhc need the application context you need to set it up   
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:57): to do that, simply lookup Container component and call setApplicationContext  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 15:57): ok  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:58): then if you have component sthat require to receive the start event you also need to send it  
rahul joined #xwiki at 15:58  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:58): basically if you want something that fully works for all cases you need the init from http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-containers/xwiki-container-servlet/src/main/java/org/xwiki/container/servlet/XWikiServletContextListener.java  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:59): (replacing the servlet initializer stuff with your own code for initializing the app context)  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 15:59): you also don't need the last line  
florinciu - (22/06/2009 16:00): vmassol: cool! I was just afraid that a different runtime may cause problems  
cristinaS - (22/06/2009 16:00): the last line form the initialization context  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 16:01): florinciu: in the future we'll write an osgi bridge (I don't think it's hard to do) so that xwiki components are registered as osgi components  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 16:01  
rahul left at 16:03 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
rahul\_ joined #xwiki at 16:03  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:05): vmassol: Hi..   
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:06): i have commited some code to sandbox. And have soemthing working.   
vmassol - (22/06/2009 16:06): arunreddy: hi  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 16:06): cool  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:06): Implemented importing mediawiki from XE with basic features  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 16:06): I'm very busy till wednesday night but I can look starting on thursdau  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 16:06): thursday  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:07): Thanks.  
KermitTheFragger left at 16:09 ("Leaving")  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:09): All the Document handling methods are not exposed in DocumentAccessBridge.   
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:10): To handly versions, authors etc..  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:13): vmassol : Is there any other way out using components to get the wiki runtime and create the documents.   
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 16:13): Assign hierarchy to documents.  
cristinaS left at 16:16 ("Bersirc 2.2: All the original sexiness of Bersirc, open to the world. [ http://www.bersirc.org/ - Open Source IRC ]")  
cristinas joined #xwiki at 16:21  
maggolo joined #xwiki at 16:36  
maggolo - (22/06/2009 16:37): hi @ all  
maggolo - (22/06/2009 16:38): hi tmortange do you have time to give me support again with my ptogramming rights and LDAP connection in virtual wiki again?  
Chathurag1 joined #xwiki at 16:38  
Chathurag left at 16:52 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
rahul joined #xwiki at 16:52  
rahul\_\_ joined #xwiki at 17:00  
rahul\_\_ left at 17:03 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
rahul\_\_ joined #xwiki at 17:03  
rahul\_\_ left at 17:05 (Client Quit)  
rahul\_ left at 17:10 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
rahul left at 17:19 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
florinciu left at 17:22 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
tachirei left at 17:23 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
guillaum1 left at 18:02 ("Leaving.")  
anamarias left at 18:09 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
arkub joined #xwiki at 18:09  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 18:10  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 18:11): vmassol: thanks a lot for the example .. i managed to create the component manager and now i have a xwiki synatx - xhtml converter in my extension  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 18:15): cristinas: cool :)  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 18:26  
glerouge left at 18:31 ("Gone chasing a unicorn in the twilight zone")  
jvelociter left at 18:37 ()  
cristinas left at 18:40 ("Leaving")  
arkub left at 18:47 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
Enygma` left at 18:54 ("Leaving.")  
mflorea left at 19:10 ("Leaving")  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 19:19  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 19:29  
anamarias left at 19:39 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 19:40  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:40): hi sdumitriu   
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:40): Hi anamarias  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:40): how can I test a component module (i created one which uses as a requirement the DocummentAccessBridge component) ?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:40): do I have to add to XWiki enterprise and make a short velocity/groovy script ?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:40): or is it a more simpler direct way ?  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:42): JUnit test?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:43): i only have a couple of fresh created modules, will it have any documents if I test them ?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:43): i mean, just the modules   
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:44): "documents"?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:44): DocummentAccessBridge fetches xwiki documents/pages no ?  
arkub joined #xwiki at 19:44  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:45): or any data  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:45): Yes  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:45): But you can use a mock  
tmortagne left at 19:46 ("Ex-Chat")  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:46): This means that you're not using the real bridge used in XE, but a MockDocumentAccessBridge  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:46): You tell it what to return  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:46): And register it as the default implementation for the DocumentAccessBridge component  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:47): vmassol: Do you have a quick link for an example of how the MockDocumentAccessBridge is used?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:47): hmm, the whole idea of the component was to tie it to the real data in the XE  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:47): anamarias: Yes, when using it for real  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:47): to be able to fetch a user  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:47): but for tests you don't want a real environment  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:48): A real environment is too big and too slow  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:48): how do i know what the mock should return if i don't know how the real environment returns then ?  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:49): Well, you find out what the mock should return in a manual run  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:49): For this, you can use a real wiki  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:49): with some scripts ?  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:50): sdumitriu: yep, hold on  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:51): you create the mock with jmock and then you call getComponentManager().registerComponent(DocumentAccessBridge.class, mockinstance)  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:52): so it's not as easy as doing this:  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:52):     @Requirement  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:52):     private DocumentAccessBridge documentAccessBridge;  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:52): anamarias: That is correct  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:52): i'll have to use the ComponentManager  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:52): That is your component  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 19:53): You have to use the CM in the test class  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:53): ah, only in the test class, the implementation of my component uses DocumentAccessBridge documentAccessBridge  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:53): still  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:54): i'll also have to implement MockDocumentAccessBridge class, right ?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:55): vmassol: what is jmock ?  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:55): anamarias: http://www.jmock.org/  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:55): nope  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:55): you don't need to implement it  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:56): you can use jmock to create a dynamic mock for it  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 19:57): what is the result of jmock ? this MockDocumentAccessBridge class ?  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:58): a mock instance of DocumentAccessBridge yes  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:59): it's dynamic  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:59): it's not code generation  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:59): s/code generation/static code generation/  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:59): it's bytecode code generation at runtime  
vmassol - (22/06/2009 19:59): (using dynamic proxies or bytecode generation)  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 20:02): like here ? http://www.jmock.org/mocking-classes.html  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:05): Here's an example: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-macros/xwiki-rendering-macro-include/src/test/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/macro/IncludeMacroTest.java  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 20:08): this is how it tells the mock what should return for each method : mockDocumentAccessBridge.expects(once()).method("isDocumentViewable").will(returnValue(true));, no ?  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:08): Yes  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 20:09): ok  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 20:10): something else, is a component only consists of the interface (service) and its implementation ? or can it have multiple (helper) classes ? are they considered part of the component as well ?  
cristinas joined #xwiki at 20:11  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:12): The component is just the interface  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:12): The implementation can use as many classes as needed  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 20:12): can it also implement as many interfaces as needed ?  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 20:12): not just the comp interface and the Initializable one ?  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:13): Yes  
anamarias - (22/06/2009 20:14): ok, thanks a lot. i'm out of questions for now :p  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:15): sdumitriu: hi!   
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:16): Hi cristinas  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:18): i've solved the exception and now the xwiki syntax - xhtml converter works .. and i would like to commit but using git   
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:18): K  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:18): Did you checkout already?  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:19): it is possible to do this or i should commit with svn .. and then checkout  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:19): nope  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 20:19): sdumitriu: Hi  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:19): i'm using svn now  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:19): It is better to commit with svn now  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:19): ok, thanks  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:19): Since otherwise you will have to copy the files from one folder to the other  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:20): sounds not so good , i will checkout then with git after i commit  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:20): Yes, that's best  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:21): Follow the first steps on http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/UsingGit  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:21): The URL you should checkout is https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/xoo/  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:21): Hi arunreddy  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:21): ok  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:22): git svn clone --username=cristinas https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/xoo/  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 20:27  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:27):  'svn' is not a git-command. See 'git --help'  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:27): am I doing something wrong?  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 20:27): cristinas : you need git-svn lib  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:27): Hm, I think you don't have git svn  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:27): oh, ok thanks  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:27): git -v  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:28): git --version  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:28): git version 1.5.6.3  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:28): I have 1.6.0.6  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:29): k, I'll get a newer version  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 20:29): i have 1.6.0.4 --  and a error.. : W: Ignoring error from SVN, path probably does not exist: (160013): Filesystem has no item: '/svnroot/xwiki/!svn/bc/100/sandbox/gsoc/importexport' path not found  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 20:31): sdumitriu: git svn clone --username=arun https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/importexport/  ends up with some warnings   
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 20:32): sdumitriu : And suggestions on my app. ?  
sdumitriu - (22/06/2009 20:32): The warnings are normal  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:39): i've installed git-svn lib and now it works  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:39): thanks  
arunreddy - (22/06/2009 20:43): do you get any warnings.?  
cristinas - (22/06/2009 20:44): yes
